page.title: 10LOCAL DELICACY OF LEEK
page.content: Oatcakes are a flat,savoury pancake specially made in this area. The oatcake shop in Heywood street is unique to Leek because the nearest oatcake shop is in Sheffield.The owner of the shop is Mrs Pam Smith,whose family has run it for over 18 years.About 180 people come into her shop and buy oatcakes a day.Mrs Smith makes about 30 dozen oatcakes a day.Oatcakes cost 5p each. Here is the recipe they use(makes 7,8): { 7oz medium oatmeal} { 3 level teaspoons salt} { 5oz plain flour} { 3 quarters of a pint of cold water} Mix all the dry ingredients together.Add all the cold water and leave over night.Then add 1 level tsp. of baking powder and 1 quarter of cold water .Mix then fry.They are lovely warm with melted cheese.
